text: there are soaps there are creams there
are pairs there are scrubs all sorts of
things for a person like me I mean I am
considered as somebody who is who is
going to have a difficult time getting
married because I am not fair I remember
when I was young my paternal grandmother
she used to put these homemade turmeric
paste mixed with milk and cream which
would make my skin fair or Kira so there
was this inherent pressure because of
the anticipation of marriage basically
that the boy will not like you the
family will not like you if you are not
fair
so I feel this is this is counter for
post-colonial hangover that one has to
look fair in order to be elite
sophisticated and have a good-looking
lineage in the last four or five years
things have changed but I'm not sure if
it's for good because now there's
pressure on men as well to look fair and
there are a number of powders and and
skin lightening creams which have come
out for men
